results.title: Easy street [Music version]
results.brief_description: The Tramp, played by Chaplin, reformed by angelic Edna Purviance, joins the police force and his first job is to tame the local bully (Eric Campbell). Also features Albert Austin and Henry Bergman. Musical score by Winston S. Sharples. No spoken word or intertitles - music soundtrack only.

results.title: The Fatal glass of beer
results.creator_credit: Clyde Bruckman, Mack Sennett and Mack Sennett Comedies
results.brief_description: This film is about a prodigal son returning to a snowbound cabin in the Yukon. Described as an absurd star comedy with appeal to addicts only: most of the humour consists of repeats of one line, “Taint a fit night out for man nor beast”. This film was written by W.C. Fields who also starred in it, along with Rosemary Theby, George Chandler and Richard Cramer.

results.title: Animated motion. Pt. 4
results.creator_credit: Grant Munro, Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In this fourth film, Norman McLaren explains and illustrates composite motion, where two of the categories of motion occur simultaneously in one action, as are the motions of jointed or pivoted parts (as occur in animal and human movements). Also shown is a human gesture with increasing amounts of emotion; and finally, the phenomenon of “strobing” in animation is examined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Grant Munro, Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.description: In this fourth film, Norman McLaren explains and illustrates composite motion, where two of the categories of motion occur simultaneously in one action, as are the motions of jointed or pivoted parts (as occur in animal and human movements). Also shown is a human gesture with increasing amounts of emotion; and finally, the phenomenon of “strobing” in animation is examined.

results.title: Animated motion. Pt. 3
results.creator_credit: Grant Munro, Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Zero motion and irregular motion (the other two of the five categories of motion) are examined by Norman McLaren in this part of the series. Immobility (or “zero motion”) and its duration, when occurring within a context of motion, plays a vital role in animation. The student sees how irregular motion, though seldom found in nature, can be used freely by the animator.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Grant Munro, Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Dismissal
results.creator_credit: Carl Schultz, George Miller, George Ogilvie, John Power, Phil Noyce, Terry Hayes and Kennedy-Miller
results.brief_description: A fictional account of the events that led up to the decision, made by Sir John Kerr, to sack Gough Whitlam as Prime Minister and appoint Malcolm Fraser in his place.

constellations_other.name: George Miller
constellations_other.description: For a guy who started his career as a physician, George Miller sure is a diverse filmmaker.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Carl Schultz, George Miller, George Ogilvie, John Power, Phil Noyce, Terry Hayes and Kennedy-Miller
results.description: A fictional account of the events that led up to the decision, made by Sir John Kerr, to sack Gough Whitlam as Prime Minister and appoint Malcolm Fraser in his place. The events covered occurred over the period between 1972 and 1975 and have been arranged, in the film, into six parts. Cast: Peter Carroll, Bill Hunter, John Hargreaves, John Meillon, Max Phipps, John Stanton, Arthur Dignam, Ruth Cracknell, Nancy Hayes.
description_for_label: A fictional account of the events that led up to the decision, made by Sir John Kerr, to sack Gough Whitlam as Prime Minister and appoint Malcolm Fraser in his place. results.title: Stepfamily Dynamics
results.creator_credit: Jane Keehn, Justine Anderson, Paul Van Dacon, Shaun Gibbons, Velissa Cheers and Robert Ketton
results.brief_description: Five vignettes are shown and each one illustrates a different situation in stepfamily life. The purpose of the vignettes is to increase the awareness of the complex interactions in the contemporary stepfamily and this video is a useful educational or counselling aid for stepfamily couples

results.creator_credit: Peter Jordan and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School

results.title: Especially the children
results.brief_description: In the developing world, simple survival is the basic need for many children and their families. UNICEF seeks for all children the basic rights and privileges set forth in the Declaration of the Rights of the Child.
